verb.description: Go to see and spend time with (someone) socially.
examples: I came to visit my grandmother
he went out to visit with his pals

verb.description: Inflict (something harmful or unpleasant) on someone.
examples: the mockery visited upon him by his schoolmates

noun.description: An act of going or coming to see a person or place socially, as a tourist, or for some other purpose.

origin: Middle English: from Old French visiter or Latin visitare go to see, frequentative of visare to view, from videre to see.
